licence_overview:
$! You will need authorisation if you want to provide claims management services - eg help people make accident claims. $!

Claims management companies can provide services for the following legal claims:

- personal injury
- employment
- criminal injuries compensation
- Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit
- housing disrepair
- financial products or services

You won't normally need to apply if you're one of the following:

- insurance company, broker or independent financial adviser
- solicitor, barrister or legal executive
- independent trade union or student union official
- charity or not-for-profit advice body
- Independent Complaints Reviewer

##How to apply

You can [apply online](https://www.claimsregulation.gov.uk/application/ "apply online"){:rel="external"} or phone the Claims Management Regulator:

$C
**Claims Management Regulator**  
0333 200 1321
$C

You will have to pay an application fee of £950, as well as an annual fee if you're authorised.

The regulator will aim to deal with your application within 45 days.

Authorised businesses are listed on the [Ministry of Justice website.](https://www.claimsregulation.gov.uk/search.aspx "Ministry of Justice website"){:rel="external"}

##Fines and penalties

If you provide claims management services without authorisation, you could be fined, imprisoned for up to 2 years, or both.
